background: Scales are collected from natural-origin adult broodstock to determine the age structure of the brood that are propagated for the Chief Joseph Hatchery integrated program. Samples are sent to a lab on scale cards with appropriate biological information (species, date, length, mark, status). Results for individual fish will includeage and natural (wild) or hatchery classification.A summary of the results will inform hatchery managers on the age composition of hatchery broodstock and performance standards for the integrated program.
title: Determine Age Composition of Adult Chinook from Scale Samples
assumptions: We sample approximately 660 natural-origin adult Chinook. This is the target sample from the population.
objectives: Determine natural-origin broodstock by marks and tags
Send scale samples to the WDFW lab for analysis
Collect scales from all broodstock during hatchery spawning
Results from scale lab will provide total age of fish
